A Safe Version of select.list() for Interactive and TTY Use

Source: R/RcppExports.R
select_list_safe.Rd

Provides a cross-platform wrapper for R's select.list() that works both in interactive R sessions and in non-interactive Rscript sessions at a terminal (TTY). If running interactively, it calls utils::select.list(). If running in a non-interactive terminal, it displays a textual menu and captures numeric input from the user.

Arguments

choices

A character vector of choices to present.

title

Optional title string to display above the menu (like in select.list()).

multiple

Logical; if TRUE, the user may select multiple items by entering space-separated numbers.

Value

A character string or character vector of selections. Returns an empty string ("") if the user cancels by entering 0. If multiple = TRUE, a character vector of selected items is returned.

Details

This function is especially useful in command-line scripts that need user input in a controlled and fallback-compatible way.

See also

utils::select.list()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  select_list_safe(c("Apples", "Oranges", "Bananas"), title = "Select fruit:")
} # }
